com.topcoder.util.objectfactory
Class ObjectSpecification

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.util.objectfactory.ObjectSpecification
public class ObjectSpecification
extends java.lang.Object

The object that contains the specification, or the metadata, that the ObjectFactory will use to instantiate objects. This object will be created in the SpecificationFactory. The ConfigManagerSpecificationFactory creates these from configuration and stores them in a map. This class is almost immutable, with only the getParams method exposing the inner array structure, but since this class is meant to be used internally, this is not a concern. This class is thread safe.

Version:
2.0
Author:
codedoc, mgmg

Constructor Detail

ObjectSpecification

public ObjectSpecification(java.lang.String specType,
                           java.lang.String jar,
                           java.lang.String type,
                           java.lang.String identifier,
                           java.lang.String value,
                           int dimension,
                           java.lang.Object[] params)

Creates an instance of the specification. Must follow the following rules: - if specType is simple - type must be one of the simple types defined in this class - dimension is set to 1 - parameters is set to null - if specType is array - type must correspond to the type of the params - dimension must correspond to the dimension of the params - value is set to null - if specType is complex - type must not be one of the simple types defined in this class - dimension is set to 1 - value is set to null - if specType is null - type must be a valid Object type - dimension is set to 1 - value is set to null If these rules are not followed, the result is a IllegalArgumentException

Parameters:
specType - spec type
jar - jar name and path
type - fully-qualified name of Object or name of supported simple type, or type of array
identifier - additional identifier to an object specification
value - value of the simple type
dimension - dimension of the params
params - parameter specifications to be converted to objects for the constructor/array
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specType is not one of the three types, type is null/empty, dimension < 1, or the rules specified in the text are not followed.
